titleInfo.title: Treaty between the East India Company and the King of Oudh

physicalDescription.extent: There is an abstract of contents of the despatch, numbered 1-15, on folios 138-139. These numbers are repeated for reference on the last verso of each enclosure.

mods.abstract: Enclosures to Despatch to the Secret Committee No. 13, dated 2 October 1837.The enclosures relate to the signing of a new treaty between the East India Company and the King of Oude [Oudh, Muhammad Ali Shah], and consist mainly of correspondence from Lieutenant-Colonel John Low, Resident at Lucknow. The enclosures are dated 26 August-28 September 1837.The papers cover: reports by the Resident at Lucknow of discussions with the King and his ministers, and the progress of negotiations over a new treaty; copy of the treaty between the East India Company and the King of Oudh, dated 11 September 1837; and letters and minutes from the Governor General and British officials concerning the treaty, the internal administration of Oudh, and British policy toward Oudh.
